mlflex.core
Class FeatureSelectionAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
  mlflex.core.FeatureSelectionAlgorithm

public class FeatureSelectionAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object

This class acts as a wrapper for performing feature-selection tasks. It interprets parameters for executing these tasks, based on what has been configured in ML-Flex's configuration files.

Author:
Stephen Piccolo

Constructor

Parameters:
key - Unique name to reference the algorithm
learnerKey - Unique name of the ML-Flex Java class that extends AbstractMachineLearner and contains the logic for interfacing with the external library (where applicable)
algorithmParameters - List of parameters that are passed to the algorithm

java.lang.Exception
Method Detail

IsNone

public boolean IsNone()
Indicates whether no feature selection/ranking should be performed.

Returns:
Whether no feature selection/ranking should be performed.

IsPriorKnowledge

public boolean IsPriorKnowledge()
Indicates wheter prior-knowledge selection/ranking shold be performed. In this approach, the user typically specifies a list of features that are considered to be most informative based on a literature review.

Returns:
Whether prior-knowledge selection/ranking should be performed.

SelectFeatures

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> SelectFeatures(DataInstanceCollection trainData)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
This is a pass-through method to rank/select features. It throws a detailed exception if it cannot be performed.

Parameters:
trainData - Training data instances
Returns:
List of ranked features (in order)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
